reviewText: Great music, great musicians, great history.

Nice documentary on the history of slack key with beautiful Hawaiian landscapes as background, and older footage of various famous Slack key musicians. Broader in scope than Friedman's documentary, and seems more focused on the spiritual and family underpinnings of Hawaiian Slack key music.
Takes u into the history of slack key. Loved the stories in it. Gives u an appreciation for the beauty of it.

This is a great video to add to your collection of the understanding where the art of Slack Key came from and where it will take the future generation of those who play Kihoalu..Mahalao to Uncle Eddie Kamae for a great job.

We bought this on the recommendation of a friend, who is very in to Hawaiian music. it is such a lovely video about many of the slack key masters. It gives you a little of the history and tradition of the music, as well as how it has changed through the years. Since we love Hawaii and the music, it made us feel as though we were there again.
The Hawaiian Way - Ki ho'alu Slack Key is an excellent documentary.  The interviews of artists and hearing the old and new slack key played is very informative.
